description.narrative: The objective of the Agriculture Strengthening and Accession Project for Macedonia is to improve the delivery of the Borrower's assistance to the agriculture sector in a manner consistent with the European Union's (EU) pre-accession requirements. The closing date for the project will be extended from September 30, 2011 until June 30, 2012. The extension is necessary to allow additional time for remaining project activities to be completed. One ongoing specific activity, the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Water Economy (MAFWE) headquarters building construction, is close to completion. However, the main contractor has been unable to pay the essential sub-contractors to complete the relevant works due to financial issues. The Bank team has assessed and discussed progress under this activity during a Technical Mission on March 14-18, 2011, and has presented the client with options for proceeding with the construction. The Government is now in the process of resolving this situation to finalize construction by October 2011. With respect to the remaining training activities and the implementation of software packages (listed in the letter from the Government), these activities are on track to be completed by the planned dates. The project team fully supports the request as the extension will provide the time needed to fully achieve project objectives. This will be the first extension of the project.

condition.narrative: The borrower shall adopt a medium term veterinary strategy satisfactory to the Bank
The borrower shall ensure that severence payments made under part IV.1 of the project are made in accordance with procueduresacceptable to the bank.
the Borrower shall submit, no later than December 1, an annual work program for each year

title.narrative: Animal health and food hygiene reference laboratories achieve method/test work to pass ISO 17025 accreditation.

baseline.value: 0% of Animal health laboratories in compliance with ISO 17025

target.value: Animal health and food hygiene reference laboratories fully compliant with ISO 17025

actual.value: The lab tests are fully in compliance with the requirements set by the FVA.

title.narrative: WEs successfully collecting water user fees from all users and breaking even financially

baseline.value: About 10% of irrigation water fees are collected

comment.narrative: Water fee collections continue into the following year (2013). Therefore this is not a final percentage.

title.narrative: Reduction of prevalence of TB/BRU in ruminant livestock, number of officially "clean" herds

baseline.value: BRU in cattle is 0,34% of total population; BRU in sheep and goat is 2,5 % and TB in cattle is 0,2% of total population; CSF 11outbreaks; ND insufficient data; Design VIS workflow and program

title.narrative: Improved MAFWE ability to disburse and track use of subsidies and rural development funds and to evaluate their impact on the agri-food sector

baseline.value: Information lacking to forecast uptake, report and analyze subsidies; poor targeting, monitoring and verification

actual.value: FADN is in place and used for the preparation of the 2013 subsidy program. According to the EU, the FADN is in a good position tocomply with the EU requirements.

title.narrative: Paying Agency accredited for managing IPARD fund on behalf of the European Commission for processing IPARD funds; Delegated for delivering of national direct payments program

baseline.value: No Accredited IPARD Paying Agency, no central processing agency for national direct payments, Law of PA adopted

target.value: Conferral of Management for additional measures published by the EC

actual.value: PA accredited since 2009 and manages IPARD and national funds/payments.

title.narrative: Effective delivery of EU compliant food safety certification to producers and agro-processors

baseline.value: No EU compliant official control procedures established; No food establishment approved as EU compliant; Brucellosis/tuberculosiscontrol and eradication programs ineffective. Drafted national food safety legislation compliant with EU.

target.value: 75% of food establishments inspected and approved; 75% of sheep/goat flocks and bovine herds tested and declared free fromBRU/TBC;National legislation compliant with EU.

actual.value: 75% of food establishments inspected and approved; 75% of sheep/goat flocks and bovine herds tested and declared free fromBRU/TBC;National legislation compliant with EU.

title.narrative: Integrated Administrative and Control System (IACS) is established and functional, including an operational Integrated Farm Register and functioning Land Parcel Identification System

baseline.value: No Farm registry and no Land parcel identification

actual.value: The farm registry is fully operational and will be used for cross checks in the 2013 national agricultural support program. TheLPIS is fully developed.

title.narrative: EU IPARD Funds are paid to farmers in an EU compliant manner

actual.value: Payments are being made. Five calls for applications for IPARD support have now been made by the Paying Agency (PA). The PA isadministrating applications and making payments in an EU compliant manner.

title.narrative: Market Information Systems (MIS) and Farm Accountancy Data Network (FADN) established and fully operational, and appropriately linked to IACS

target.value: Structures for establishing full MIS databawe in place.

title.narrative: Potential IPARD beneficiaries apply using correct procedures

target.value: 95% of the planned IPARD funds for the calendar year, 80% of previous year commitments disbursed

actual.value: IPARD absorption is low, and only 46 payments have been executed to date ofor a total of 2.1 million Euros. The paying agency isimplementing changes to measures in the hope of increasing IPARd dibursements.

title.narrative: List of abattoirs and meat processing facilities established for IPARD funding, and number of EU compliant certifications of facilities

baseline.value: None of the nation's abattoirs and meat processing plants have EU compliant facilities and procedures (except HACCP app. 10%)

target.value: 75% of abattoirs and meat processing plants in compliance with EU requirements

actual.value: No updated data at this point.

title.narrative: Reduced financial burden to government from irrigation management

baseline.value: WEs depending on state assistance for cost recovery

target.value: WEs effectively representing user interest and collecting invoiced irrigation user fees at 60%.

title.narrative: Successfully established Water Economies (WEs) in Kumanovo, Strumica-Radovis, Pelagonjia, Prile, Skopje, Juzna, Vardarska Dolina

actual.value: All WEs under this indicator have been established and staffed, and are now fully functionning. All funds for incrementaloperatingcosts have been disbursed.
